author: orlandosentinel.com
title: Winter Garden cop breaks knee cap in struggle with Victoria's Secret theft suspect
text:
A Winter Garden police officer is recovering after breaking his knee cap during a struggle with a man accused of stealing more than $750 worth of merchandise from a Victoria’s Secret store, officials say.
In a broken radio call just after 1:30 p.m. Tuesday, backup officers heard Officer Jose Rivera say he needed help at the lingerie store on Daniels Road in Winter Garden.
Rivera was fighting with a man, who was trying to stop him from using his police radio, an arrest report states. He asked for backup to “step it up.”
The other officers arrived to find Rivera on the ground trying to pin down 300-pound, 5-foot and 6-inch tall Algernon Jemau Baker, 23, of Orlando, according to the report.
It took three officers to finally subdue him, police said.
The backup officers started investigating and learned Baker was possibly working with a woman, 28-year-old Chris Everette Lema, to shoplift from various stores in the Winter Garden Village mall, according to the report.
Rivera intercepted Baker in the parking lot outside Victoria’s Secret while he was “dropping off items” to their car, the report states. Lema was arrested near the store’s front door.
Police said the pair had more than $750 worth of stolen Victoria’s Secret merchandise. Details about what was stolen weren’t released, but a store manager met with police to recover it, the report states.
Emergency crews took Rivera to a hospital, where he was treated for the broken knee cap and a bite wound on his right thumb, according to the report.
Lt. Scott Allen said Thursday that Rivera is “recovering well and in good spirits.”
Records show Baker was being held in the Orange County Jail on $10,400 bail. Lema has since been released.
